settings.title: Sustainability & Materials
settings.description: At the beginning of our journey, we questioned conventional practices in the fashion industry. Now, with each collection, we continue to examine the impact we have on our planet.
settings.sub-description: We take responsibility for every material we use and strive to work in mutual collaboration with our suppliers, seeking transparency and traceability across our supply chain.

settings.title: Our Fibres
settings.description: We prioritise the use of natural, renewable and certified organic materials when designing our collections. All of our fabrics are vegan, selected to have the lowest impact on our global environment.
settings.sub-description: By focusing on the past, present and future of our clothes and working closely with our suppliers, we make strides towards a more responsible, transparent future.

settings.product-description: Organic Cotton is a natural fabric, both durable and biodegradable. It’s comfortable, breathable and hypoallergenic. We only use GOTS certified organic cotton – grown with respect to the farmers and their land without the use of pesticides, making it less harmful on your skin and on the planet.

Lightweight, smooth and breathable, TENCEL​​™ is made from sustainable and renewable Eucalyptus wood pulp. It’s a stronger alternative to viscose that is long-lasting and certified as biodegradable. Soft as silk, the fabric is comfortable to wear and easy to care for.

ENKA​​® Viscose is a luxurious fabric spun from sustainable and renewable wood sources. Manufactured in Europe combining traditional and innovative production methods, it’s a luxurious, endless yarn valued for its soft touch and skin friendliness.

MicroModal is a viscose fabric made from renewable wood sources. Similar to cotton and silk, yet easier to care for, it has a unique softness and comfort. The lightweight, breathable fabric also absorbs moisture – perfect to wear close to the skin.

Linen is a biodegradable, low-impact fibre made from the flax plant that doesn’t need pesticides or fertilisers to grow. Strong and stain resistant, it’s the ideal summer fabric as it absorbs moisture and stays cool in warm weather.

settings.title: Our Finishes
settings.description: We place a lot of importance on the finishing touches of our garments, ensuring every detail is of the highest quality with the lowest environmental impact. All our buttons are plant-based and our metals nickel-free.
settings.sub-description: By focusing on the past, present and future of our clothes and working closely with our suppliers, we make strides towards a more responsible, transparent future.

settings.product-description: Our BioResin mother-of-pearl buttons are made in Italy with a resin created from trees, leaves and plant material to replace plastic-based and shell buttons. Replicating true mother of pearl’s iridescence, they are biodegradable and don’t release any toxic emissions.

Cultivated in Ecuador, Corozo is a palm nut that is sun-dried, naturally dyed and finished as buttons in Italy. It’s an organic, vegan alternative to plastic and ivory that doesn’t contribute to the loss of biodiversity or deforestation in the Amazon.

We only use nickel-free metal for our zips and rings, which doesn’t harm our health nor the environment. The tape on our zips is made from GOTS certified organic cotton or recycled polyester certified by the Global Recycle Standard (GRS).

settings.caption: (above) factory workers in bangladesh putting the finishing touches to collection 20

settings.title: Our Factories
settings.description: Sustainability is about taking responsibility for every decision we make. It goes beyond simply the materials we use; for us it incorporates respectful working environments, garment longevity, transparency and traceability, animal welfare and water stewardship.
settings.sub-description: By focusing on the past, present and future of our clothes and working closely with our suppliers, we make strides towards a more responsible, transparent future.

settings.company-description: Echotex operates with planet, people and product at its heart. Industry-leading, it was the first factory in Bangladesh to offer health insurance for all workers, fair wages and a free lunch, every day.
settings.list-content-1: Its pioneering ethical practices help to safeguard and improve the wellbeing of the workforce.
settings.list-content-2: Sustainable production processes produce excellent quality products without compromising the environment or our brand values.

settings.company-description: Echoknits is a factory specialising in true sustainable knitwear. Owned by Ninety Percent’s co-founder Shafiq Hassan, it puts the wellbeing of its employees first and is constantly improving its approach to energy saving and sustainability.
settings.list-content-1: It provides free healthcare, family support and dining facilities on site.
settings.list-content-2: It carries optimal certifications guaranteeing superior quality, technical know-how and green initiatives.

settings.company-description: Echotekstil collaborates with a family-run atelier in Turkey specialised in delicate woven pieces. Started as a fabric merchant, the third generation business is expanding with the support of Echotekstil, working hand-in-hand to produce responsibly-made fashion with craftsmanship at its heart.
settings.list-content-1: It supports small local garment manufacturers and helps them to export products to Northern Europe.
settings.list-content-2: Every step of the product development is checked according to ethical compliance.

settings.caption: caption
settings.main-desc: We only use environmental dyes certified by OEKO-TEX® and Bluesign® which set and control standards for a safe and sustainable textile production.
settings.title: Our Processes
settings.desc: 80% of our profits are shared between five charitable causes. Chosen because they speak to our values. Eclectic in their reach, but each cause is connected through their own care for people and planet. Our chosen charities are Big Life and Wild Aid, BRAC, Children's Hope and War Child UK

settings.product-description: Beyond our items, our voile labels are organic cotton, our care labels are organic cotton ribbon and our woven neck label is a recycled polyester and organic cotton. All of our organic cotton is Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) certified.

Our swing tags are on unbleached FSC certified paper, their string is Organic Cotton. The garment bags our items arrive in are biodegradable – please pop them into your recycle bin to return them to the Earth.
The garment bags our items arrive in are biodegradable – please pop them into your recycle bin to return them to the Earth.

settings.title: Longevity: Caretaking
settings.text: Care and consideration with your clothes is the best way to ensure their longevity. Though our clothes are designed to last, care and consideration will ensure their longevity.
